articles.title: Nvidia passes Apple as world's most valuable company
articles.summary: Nvidia has once again surpassed Apple to become the world's most valuable publicly traded company, reaching a market cap of $3.43 trillion. This comes as Nvidia's stock has nearly tripled in 2024 due to high demand for its GPUs in the AI market, while Apple's shares are up about 17% this year. Nvidia is also set to join the Dow Industrial Average, replacing Intel.

articles.title: Nvidia briefly overtakes Apple as world's most valuable company—it began in a breakfast booth at Denny's
articles.summary: Nvidia briefly surpassed Apple as the world's most valuable company with a market cap of $3.38 trillion driven by its advanced AI chips. The company's journey began with its co-founders at a Denny's in 1993, overcoming early failures to become a dominant force in AI and computing. CEO Jensen Huang attributes their success to a combination of vision, luck, and 61 years of hard work.

articles.title: Nvidia surpasses Apple to become world’s most valuable company
articles.summary: Nvidia has overtaken Apple to become the world's most valuable company, with its market capitalization reaching $3.43 trillion. This shift highlights the increasing dominance of artificial intelligence in the technology sector, as Nvidia's shares have nearly tripled in 2024. The AI darling's stock closed at $139.91 on Tuesday.

articles.title: Nvidia to take Intel's spot on Dow Jones Industrial Average
articles.summary: Nvidia, a leading force in AI chips, is set to replace Intel on the Dow Jones Industrial Average after Intel's 25-year run, reflecting a significant shift in the chipmaking market. This change comes as Intel's shares have declined significantly and Nvidia's valuation has soared due to its pivotal role in generative AI. Sherwin-Williams will also join the index, replacing Dow, effective next week.

articles.title: How Nvidia Overtook Apple as World's Most Valuable Company
articles.summary: Nvidia briefly surpassed Apple to become the world's most valuable company, driven by the immense demand for its specialized AI chips crucial for advanced AI applications. This shift highlights the growing importance of AI-driven technologies in the tech market, with Nvidia benefiting significantly from the race among tech giants to dominate AI. While Apple later regained its lead, Nvidia's surge underscores the impact of AI on market valuations and investment trends.

articles.title: NVIDIA and Sherwin-Williams Set to Join Dow Jones Industrial Average; Vistra to Join Dow Jones Utility Average
articles.summary: NVIDIA Corp. and The Sherwin-Williams Co. are set to join the Dow Jones Industrial Average, replacing Intel Corp. and Dow Inc., respectively. This change aims to provide more representative exposure to the semiconductor and materials sectors. Additionally, Vistra Corp. will replace The AES Corp. in the Dow Jones Utility Average to better represent the Independent Power Producers and Renewable Electricity Producers industry.

articles.title: AI investment heat remains strong, with major asset management giants rushing to seize opportunities through etf deployment.
articles.summary: AI investment continues to surge, prompting asset management companies to launch new ETFs focused on artificial intelligence. Over a third of the more than 20 AI-named ETFs were released this year, with their combined assets reaching $4.5 billion. Major tech companies like Microsoft and Amazon are engaging in an "AI arms race," significantly increasing capital expenditure in the sector, while venture capital funding for AI startups is also seeing a substantial boost.

articles.title: 3 Ways Stock-Split Stocks Nvidia and Sherwin-Williams Are Modernizing the Dow Jones Industrial Average
articles.summary: This article discusses how the additions of Nvidia and Sherwin-Williams to the Dow Jones Industrial Average are modernizing the index. It highlights that stock splits are crucial for inclusion in the price-weighted Dow, unlike market-cap-weighted indexes. The changes signify a shift towards a more tech-focused and growth-oriented Dow, moving away from its traditional emphasis on blue-chip dividend stocks.

articles.title: New companies are coming to the Dow Jones
articles.summary: Nvidia and Sherwin-Williams are set to replace Intel and Dow in the Dow Jones Industrial Average, reflecting changes in key economic sectors. This move highlights Nvidia's rise in semiconductors and Sherwin-Williams' relevance, while being removed can negatively impact a company's image and stock value, especially with the prevalence of ETF investing.

articles.title: NVDX Stock Fund Price and Chart — CBOE:NVDX
articles.summary: This article provides a detailed overview of the T-Rex 2X Long NVIDIA Daily Target ETF (NVDX), including its price, chart, key statistics like AUM and expense ratio, and investment strategy. NVDX is designed for short-term, bullish bets on NVIDIA, offering 200% daily leveraged exposure and involves high risk due to daily rebalancing and potential for total loss if NVIDIA stock declines significantly. The fund invests mainly in cash and targets the information technology sector, specifically semiconductors.

articles.title: Rackspace Brings GPU-as-a-Service to Spot Cloud Platform
articles.summary: Rackspace Technology is introducing a GPU-as-a-service offering to its Rackspace Spot platform, an online auction for cloud servers, to address the growing demand for compute power in AI. This new service, including access to Nvidia GPUs, is designed to provide cost-effective and scalable cloud infrastructure, particularly for AI, machine learning, and data analytics workloads. Rackspace is also expanding its physical presence with a new location in San Jose, California, to support this initiative.

articles.title: Opinion: AMD could still be a sleeper against Nvidia, but Wall Street isn’t yet convinced
articles.summary: AMD executives made bold statements about their AI accelerator chip and provided an updated AI chip-revenue forecast of $5 billion, which merely met analysts' expectations. This leaves investors wondering if the forecast is a concern or if AMD could become a strong competitor against Nvidia despite Wall Street's current skepticism.

articles.title: Semiconductor Giant AMD’s Stock Tumble Post Earnings Release
articles.summary: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) shares tumbled by over 6% in after-hours trading despite narrowly beating Wall Street expectations for earnings and revenue in Q3 2024. The company reported record Data Center revenue, but analysts noted that its new AI chip announcements don't significantly close the gap with Nvidia. AMD's stock had more than doubled since early 2023 due to high demand for AI chips.

articles.title: Asset managers roll out new ETFs to tap in to AI buzz
articles.summary: Asset managers are launching new exchange-traded funds (ETFs) focused on artificial intelligence to capitalize on the growing market enthusiasm for AI technologies. Over a third of AI-themed ETFs have been introduced in 2024 alone, bringing the total assets in this category to $4.5 billion. This proliferation comes as venture capital firms are also significantly increasing their investment in AI startups, with projections of $79.2 billion by year-end.

articles.title: Vanguard Information Technology ETF: 3 Reasons Why Investors Need to Own VGT Right Now
articles.summary: The Vanguard Information Technology ETF (VGT) is highlighted as a strong investment due to its focus on U.S. tech stocks, particularly mega-cap growth companies like Apple, Microsoft, and Nvidia. The article discusses VGT's impressive historical performance, its low expense ratio of 0.1%, and its significant exposure to leading technology growth companies, especially those benefiting from AI advancements. Investors are encouraged to consider VGT for long-term portfolio growth, possibly employing a dollar-cost averaging strategy to mitigate volatility.

articles.title: Ross Gerber, Cathie Wood Or Gary Black? Whose Funds Stack Up Against S&P 500's Gains In 2024?
articles.summary: The article compares the 2024 year-to-date performance of funds managed by Gary Black, Ross Gerber, and Cathie Wood against the S&P 500's 25.97% gain. Gary Black's Future Fund Active ETF (FFND) most closely matched the S&P 500 with a 25.35% return, followed by Ross Gerber's AdvisorShares Gerber Kawasaki ETF (GK) at 21.35%, while Cathie Wood's ARK Innovation ETF (ARKK) lagged with 10.46%. Kevin Paffrath's The Meet Kevin Pricing Power ETF (PP) performed the lowest among them.

articles.title: Sherwin-Williams will join Dow Jones Industrial Average on Nov. 8
articles.summary: The Sherwin-Williams Co. (NYSE: SHW) is set to join the Dow Jones Industrial Average (DJIA) on November 8, replacing Dow Inc. (NYSE:DOW). This change, along with NVIDIA Corp. replacing Intel Corp., aims to better represent the chemicals/materials and semiconductor industries within the 30-stock index. Sherwin-Williams' inclusion highlights its significant market capitalization and reputation.

articles.title: Vertiv Stock Could Keep Soaring After 175% Pop
articles.summary: Vertiv stock has surged 175% following strong third-quarter results and raised guidance, driven by increasing demand for data centers due to AI growth. The company is a market leader in data center liquid cooling and electrical equipment, with analysts bullish on its future prospects. Continued growth in AI development and data center spending is expected to further boost Vertiv's performance.

articles.title: VCI Global secures $30m investment for AI data center in Malaysia
articles.summary: VCI Global has secured an additional $30 million investment from Alumni Capital for its AI data center in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, bringing the total investment from Alumni Capital to $35 million. The facility, known as the AI Computing Center (AICC), is set to house 512 Nvidia H200 Tensor Core GPUs, with the first phase expected to be completed in Q1 2025. This investment will bolster VCI Global's strategic growth in AI cloud computing and enable it to serve customers globally, especially in Southeast Asia.

articles.title: A.I. Investor Day & AGIX Bell Ringing at Nasdaq
articles.summary: KraneShares is hosting an A.I. Investor Day and AGIX Bell Ringing ceremony at Nasdaq on November 8, 2024. The event will celebrate the launch of the KraneShares Artificial Intelligence & Technology ETF (AGIX) and feature leading investment strategists, institutional allocators, and executives from top AI firms to discuss investment opportunities in the evolving AI landscape. The discussion will cover the rapid transformation of industries by AI and its impact on the global economy.

articles.title: ASML Holding N.V. (ASML): Institutional Investors Are Shorting This Semiconductor Stock Now
articles.summary: Institutional investors are shorting ASML Holding N.V. (ASML) due to recent earnings leaks and downward guidance, signaling continued weakness in the semiconductor industry. The company, a crucial supplier of chip manufacturing equipment, saw a significant stock drop after forecasting lower 2025 net sales and weak bookings. This reflects a broader industry bifurcation where AI-driven chip stocks are performing better than those tied to other slowing sectors like electric vehicles.

articles.title: Apple introduces M4 Pro and M4 Max
articles.summary: Apple announced the new M4 Pro and M4 Max chips, expanding the M4 family with enhanced power efficiency and advanced capabilities for Mac. These chips, built on second-generation 3-nanometer technology, feature faster CPUs, GPUs with 2x faster ray-tracing, and significantly increased unified memory bandwidth, along with support for Thunderbolt 5. The M4 Pro and M4 Max are designed to deliver exceptional performance for pro and AI workloads, powering Apple Intelligence on Mac while emphasizing user privacy and environmental benefits.

articles.title: Advanced Micro Devices, Inc. Just Beat Analyst Forecasts, And Analysts Have Been Updating Their Predictions
articles.summary: Advanced Micro Devices, Inc. (AMD) recently exceeded analyst forecasts with better-than-expected EPS, despite revenues largely meeting expectations. Following these results, analysts slightly lowered their earnings per share estimates for 2025 but maintained their consensus price target at US$187. AMD is still projected to grow significantly faster than the broader semiconductor industry.

articles.title: As PayPal’s ‘AI Bump’ Fades Away, Should You Buy or Sell PYPL Stock?
articles.summary: This article discusses PayPal's stock performance following an "AI bump" that quickly faded, contrasting it with other companies that retained their gains. It evaluates PayPal's underperformance, its recent business growth and turnaround strategy under CEO Alex Chriss, and its current valuation, ultimately recommending PYPL as a buy due to reasonable pricing and future growth drivers like increased TAM and agentic commerce services.

articles.title: Advanced Micro Devices Stock Sinks as Q4 Guidance Disappoints. What to Know
articles.summary: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) stock fell after its Q4 guidance disappointed Wall Street, despite meeting Q3 expectations. Analysts are mostly bullish, with an average target price suggesting upside, but some like Oppenheimer maintain a Perform rating due to competition and valuation concerns.

articles.title: Is Apple Inc. (AAPL) a Good Stock to Buy Now According to Redditors?
articles.summary: This article examines Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) as a stock to buy according to Redditors, ranking it 5th on a list of top trending stocks. It discusses recent market trends, the impact of AI on mega-cap stocks, and strategies for hedging risks. The article highlights Apple's strong fundamentals, cash reserves, and growth potential, particularly with its new Apple Intelligence platform, citing positive analyst sentiments and a record-breaking September quarter.

articles.title: AMD Tumbles After AI Chip Growth Fails to Impress Investors
articles.summary: Advanced Micro Devices Inc. experienced its worst rout in two years after its revenue outlook for the fourth quarter fell short of Wall Street expectations, indicating slower-than-anticipated growth in its artificial intelligence sales. Despite an increased forecast for AI accelerator sales to over $5 billion this year, investors were looking for a more significant bump, leading to an 11% slide in the company's stock. AMD's gaming revenue also came in below analysts' estimates.

articles.title: T. Rowe Price PM a ‘big believer’ in crypto
articles.summary: Dominic Rizzo, who manages T. Rowe Price’s new technology-focused ETF, believes in crypto, DeFi, and stablecoins, seeing numerous future applications for these technologies. He notes that while there aren't many direct public market equity exposures to these trends, Coinbase (COIN) is a key exception within his investment framework due to its role as a "linchpin technology" and its strong fundamentals. Rizzo expects more crypto equity opportunities to emerge as the trend continues to grow.

articles.title: Sify partners with Cisco for enterprise digital transformation
articles.summary: Sify Technologies has partnered with Cisco ThousandEyes to enhance digital experience for enterprises through improved network observability and performance. This collaboration combines Sify's managed services with Cisco's advanced networking capabilities, providing detailed insights into application performance and user experience. Sify also announced significant investments in data center expansion and previous partnerships with NVIDIA and Ciena to bolster its infrastructure.

articles.title: Worried About an AI Bubble? Look to Surging International Stocks
articles.summary: Despite U.S. stocks, particularly those linked to AI, continuing to reach new highs, international stocks have shown even stronger performance, with the MSCI All Country World ex USA Index up significantly. This outperformance is attributed to more attractive valuations in international markets and a weaker U.S. dollar, prompting investors to consider diversification beyond U.S.-centric portfolios despite the U.S.'s lead in AI innovation.

articles.title: CrowdStrike at All-Time High: Still a Buy, or Time to Trim?
articles.summary: CrowdStrike Holdings Inc. (NASDAQ: CRWD) has reached a new all-time high, prompting a discussion on whether it remains a buy or if investors should consider trimming their positions. The article highlights CrowdStrike's accelerating growth driven by its subscription model and AI-driven analytics, but also points out its lofty valuation. Investors are encouraged to weigh the strong fundamentals against the high price-to-sales ratio, especially with potential risks around upcoming earnings reports.

articles.title: Broadcom (AVGO) Gains on Report That It’s Working With OpenAI
articles.summary: Broadcom Inc. shares rose after a Reuters report indicated that OpenAI is collaborating with the company to develop a new artificial intelligence chip. OpenAI is reportedly using Broadcom and TSMC to build an in-house processor to manage its increasing AI computational demands.

articles.title: Earnings call: Silvercrest reports growth amid strategic expansions
articles.summary: Silvercrest Asset Management Group Inc. (NASDAQ: SAMG) reported a 13% year-over-year increase in assets under management (AUM), reaching $35.1 billion in Q3 2024, driven by supportive markets and strategic expansions like new operations in Atlanta and Singapore. Despite a 12% rise in expenses mainly due to compensation, the company is optimistic about future organic net flows and aims to restore adjusted EBITDA margins to the upper 20s. Silvercrest emphasizes its commitment to growth investments and shareholder returns through share buybacks, while maintaining financial flexibility.

articles.title: Analysts Offer Insights on Technology Companies: CoreWeave (CRWV), GoDaddy (GDDY) and Amplitude (AMPL)
articles.summary: This article provides an overview of recent analyst ratings for three technology companies: CoreWeave (CRWV), GoDaddy (GDDY), and Amplitude (AMPL). Analysts from Bank of America Securities, UBS, and Barclays maintained or upgraded ratings, offering price targets and highlighting market consensus. The report details individual analyst performance metrics and general market sentiment for each stock.
